alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Greene; Western Albany; Western Columbia; Western Greene; Western Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Columbia, southeastern Albany and northeastern Greene Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Windham, or 11 miles northeast of Hunter, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Baltimore, Ravena, Coxsackie, Feura Bush, Selkirk, Coeymans, Cairo, Stuyvesant, Coeymans Hollow, Spawn Hollow, Dormansville, Round Top, Result, Earlton, Otter Hook, Sunside, Climax, Hervey Street, South Bethlehem and South Durham. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 21B and 21A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Albany; Eastern Greene; Western Albany; Western Columbia; Western Greene; Western Rensselaer
